what: Running reverse dependencies in the cloud
title: cloud
text: revdepcheck now supports running reverse dependencies AWS cloud, via suite functions prefixed cloud_*(). service currently available used RStudio employees, hope offer service broader R community future.

previous_headings: Running reverse dependencies in the cloud
title: cloud
text: Set RSTUDIO_CLOUD_REVDEP_KEY environment variable value cloud authentication key, provided RStudio DevOps. Add key .Renviron file usethis::edit_r_environ() restart R.

previous_headings: Running reverse dependencies in the cloud
title: cloud
text: Note going running 500+ tests using development dependency (e.g. Remote: org/pkg) may exhaust GitHub API limits. workaround use ‘url’ remote, e.g. Remote: url::https://github.com/org/pkg/archive/main.tar.gz, use GitHub API. functions keep track recently submitted job_id, assuming one job given R session can call functions without additional parameters. Provide job_id explicitly otherwise, results write revdep/{job_id}. cloud_*() functions assume current working directory root directory package trying run reverse dependencies . case cloud_*() functions take pkg parameter, can specify different directory needed.
code: # Kickoff a new check # The devel package is automatically built from the current # working directory, or specify a pre-built package with `tarball`. cloud_check()  # Follow current status of the job cloud_status()  # Cancel a job cloud_cancel()  # Retrieve results (if needed) and show a summary cloud_summary()  # Retrieve results (if needed) and generate a markdown report cloud_report()  # Retrieve details of a specfic package cloud_details(, "pkgXYZ")  # Plot running time for each package in a job cloud_plot()  # Email maintainers with failures cloud_email()  # Retrieve packages that broke in a given job cloud_broken()  # Open a web browser to the AWS job pane for the current job cloud_browse()  # Open the browser to the AWS job for a particular package # Useful for debugging why a particular job failed cloud_browse(package = "xyz")

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Csárdi G, Wickham H (2024). revdepcheck: Automated Reverse Dependency Checking. R package version 1.0.0.9002, https://github.com/r-lib/revdepcheck#readme, https://revdepcheck.r-lib.org.
code: @Manual{,   title = {revdepcheck: Automated Reverse Dependency Checking},   author = {Gábor Csárdi and Hadley Wickham},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0.9002,     https://github.com/r-lib/revdepcheck#readme},   url = {https://revdepcheck.r-lib.org}, }

title: Automated Reverse Dependency Checking
text: avoid false positives due existing failures, revdepcheck runs R CMD check twice revdep, CRAN version package, local development version. revdepcheck reports difference, can see exactly changed. speed installation revdeps dependencies, revdepcheck relies crancache. can see packages currently cached crancache::crancache_list(). revdepcheck carefully designed make long running checks pleasant possible. run checks parallel, check time limited 10 minutes, elegant progress bar keeps --date ’s happening (including estimate much time remaining).

title: Automated Reverse Dependency Checking
Automated Reverse Dependency Checking
text: Check package working directory, creating “revdep/” directory doesn’t already exist: run fails complete, run pick left : execution, run separate R process view status completed checks: Generate human-friendly summary documents revdep/: Manage “todo” list packages examine: Clear previous results recommend running revdep_check() separate process (e.g. new terminal RStudio). way, runs background tab, can easily use revdep_details(revdep = "pkg") see ’s gone wrong “pkg”.
code: library(revdepcheck) revdep_check(num_workers = 4) revdep_check(num_workers = 4) revdep_summary()                 # table of results by package  revdep_details(".", "<package>") # full details for the specified package revdep_report() ## Writing *partial* report ## Writing summary to 'revdep/README.md' ## Writing problems to 'revdep/problems.md' ## Writing failures to 'revdep/failures.md' revdep_add(pkg = ".", <packages>)  # add <packages> to the list revdep_rm(pkg = ".", <packages>).  # remove <packages> from list  revdep_add_broken()  # add all broken packages revdep_add_new()     # add newly available packages revdep_todo()        # list packages in the todo list revdep_reset()

title: Automated Reverse Dependency Checking
text: install newly fails: - install still fails: + install/check newly timeouts: t- install/check still timeouts: t+ new failures, success: + new failures: -

what: Set up/retrieve the directory structure for the checks — dir_find
title: Set up/retrieve the directory structure for the checks — dir_find
text: Currently following files directories used. main revdep directory, revdep package tree. library: collection package libraries library/data.sqlite: SQLite database contains check data. library/<checked-pkg>/old: library contains old version revdep-checked package, together dependencies. library/<checked-pkg>/new: library contains new version revdep-checked package, together dependencies. library/<pkg> libraries reverse dependencies.

title: Set up/retrieve the directory structure for the checks — dir_find
code: dir_find(   pkgdir,   what = c("root", "db", "old", "new", "pkg", "check", "checks", "lib", "pkgold",     "pkgnew", "cloud"),   package = NULL )  dir_setup(pkgdir)  dir_setup_package(pkgdir, package)

title: Set up/retrieve the directory structure for the checks — dir_find
text: pkgdir Path package revdep-checking. Directory query: "root": root check directory, "db": database file, "old": library old version package. "new": library new version package. "pkg": library reverse dependency, package argument must supplied well. "check": check directory reverse dependency, package argument must supplied well. "pkgold": package libraries use checking package old version. "pkgnew": package libraries use checking package new version. package name package, "pkg", "check", "pkgold" "pkgnew".

title: Set up/retrieve the directory structure for the checks — dir_find
text: Character scalar, requested path.

what: Manage the package checking to-do list. — revdep_add
title: Manage the package checking to-do list. — revdep_add
text: revdep_todo() tells packages still need checked. revdep_add() adds single package -list. revdep_rm() removes packages todo list. revdep_add_broken() re-adds broken packages last check (useful think fixed underlying problem package).

title: Manage the package checking to-do list. — revdep_add
code: revdep_add(pkg = ".", packages)  revdep_add_broken(   pkg = ".",   install_failures = FALSE,   timeout_failures = FALSE )  revdep_add_new(pkg = ".")  revdep_todo(pkg = ".")  revdep_rm(pkg = ".", packages)

title: Manage the package checking to-do list. — revdep_add
text: pkg Path package. packages Character vector package names add install_failures Whether re-add packages failed install. timeout_failures Whether re-add packages timed .

title: Run revdep checks — revdep_check
text: revdep_check() runs R CMD check reverse dependencies package. avoid false positives, runs R CMD check twice: released version CRAN local development version. reports differences can see checks previously ok now fail. requires use repos option provides source code packages binaries. package successfully submitted CRAN, run revdep_reset(). deletes files used checking, freeing disk space leaving clean state next release.

title: Run revdep checks — revdep_check
code: revdep_check(   pkg = ".",   dependencies = c("Depends", "Imports", "Suggests", "LinkingTo"),   quiet = TRUE,   timeout = as.difftime(10, units = "mins"),   num_workers = 1,   bioc = TRUE,   cran = TRUE,   env = revdep_env_vars() )  revdep_reset(pkg = ".")

title: Run revdep checks — revdep_check
text: pkg Path package. dependencies types revdeps checked. CRAN release, recommend using default. quiet Suppress output internal processes? timeout Maximum time wait (seconds) R CMD check complete. Default 10 minutes. num_workers Number parallel workers use bioc Also check revdeps live Bioconductor? cran cran mirror attached getOpion("repos") already present. env Environment variables set install check processes. See revdep_env_vars().

title: Run revdep checks — revdep_check
text: revdep_check() proceeds four steps: Init: create revdep/ subdirectory already exist, save list reverse dependencies check. Install: install CRAN (released) local (development) versions package, including dependencies. Run: run R CMD check twice reverse dependency, CRAN version one local version. checks run parallel using num_worker processes. Report: generate reports showing differences check results CRAN local versions package. focus report new failures. reports saved revdep/. revdep_check() designed seamlessly resume case failure: just re-run revdep_check() start left . want start scratch, run revdep_reset().

title: Display revdep results — revdep_details
text: Use see nicely formatted results processed packages revdep_check() running another process. revdep_summary() displays summary results complete checks. revdep_details() shows details one

title: Display revdep results — revdep_details
Display revdep results — revdep_details

what: This is the event loop of the revdep check process — run_event_loop
title: This is the event loop of the revdep check process — run_event_loop
text: event loop revdep check process

title: This is the event loop of the revdep check process — run_event_loop
This is the event loop of the revdep check process — run_event_loop
text: state full state check process: options contains check parameters. packages data frame packages check. See details .

title: This is the event loop of the revdep check process — run_event_loop
text: state$packages data frame columns: package: name package state: check. Possible values: todo: done anything yet deps_installing: dependencies installed now deps_installed: dependencies already installed downloading: source package check downloaded downloaded: source package downloaded checking: checking old version right now checking-checking: checking versions right now done-checking: done old version, checking new version right now checking-done: checking old version, new version already done. done-downloaded: done old version, check new version started yet done: packages checked versions start check new version check old version, simplifies state transitions bit.

what: Decide what to do next, from the current state — schedule_next_task
title: Decide what to do next, from the current state — schedule_next_task
text: reached allowed number workers, schedule idle job, just need wait worker done.

title: Decide what to do next, from the current state — schedule_next_task
Decide what to do next, from the current state — schedule_next_task
text: state See run_event_loop() description.

title: Decide what to do next, from the current state — schedule_next_task
text: Otherwise schedule job. general strategy finish check soon possible, package deps_installed, schedule check. Otherwise, package todo, schedule dependency install. nothing can now, schedule idle job, .e. just wait worker gets done.

title: revdepcheck (development version)
text: cloud_check(r_version = "4.3.1") updated default (#361). cloud_check() gains ability check Bioconductor packages via new bioc argument, default FALSE due relatively high likelihood failed checks since Bioconductor system dependencies currently installed cloud check service (#362, #369). updated pkgdown template url https://revdepcheck.r-lib.org. cloud_check() gains ability add additional packages source reverse dependencies. cran_revdeps() now accepts multiple packge names. cloud_results() gains progress bar can see ’s happening large revdep runs (#273) cloud_report() can opt-saving failures, saves CRAN report way revdep_report() (#271). revdep_report() now saves results revdep_report_cran() revdep/cran.md (#204) Exported revdep_report() write current results README.md problems.md.

title: revdepcheck 1.0.0
text: First public release.
